Dear Ms. Soliz-Quiroga:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. A six-month
provisional license is recommended based on this special investigation and special
investigation 2020C0223043 Due to the violations identified in the report, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION:
Staff 1 (female, age 20) member is having an inappropriate relationship with
Resident A (male, age 12).
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported that Staff 1 and Resident A were observed on May 11, 2020 to be
kissing on the lips and holding hands outside of the facility, “behind KF in the
woods”.
Staff 1 was suspended. Resident A moved from the facility to foster care on May 15,
2020.
Arrangements were attempted to have Resident A interviewed at the Children’s
Assessment Center in Grand Rapids. The interview with Resident A was
unsuccessful because Resident A stormed out of the interview room.
Staff 7 was interviewed by DHHS Investigator 2 and Law Enforcement Officer 4 and
said that Former Resident B told her that she had seen Resident A and Staff 1
kissing and cuddling in a television room with the lights out.
Former Resident B was interviewed by DHHS Investigator 2 and Law Enforcement
Officer 4 and confirmed what she had told Staff 7.

Resident A was interviewed at the Grand Rapids Police Station on June 26, 2020 by
DHHS Investigator 2 and Law Enforcement Officer 4. I participated by telephone.
Resident A said that he was close to Staff 1 and that she was his favorite staff. He
denied ever kissing or holding hands with her. Resident A stated that he was friends
with Staff 7 and Staff 1. Resident A stated that Staff 1 had given him a Build-A-Bear
as a gift. He stated that he gave her a "snow bear" in return. He stated that the bear
from Staff 1 was special to him because it was from Staff 1. Resident A would not
elaborate further why the bear was special. Resident A then stated that Staff 1 was
his "favorite person". He stated that she would play soccer and football with him. He
stated that he would talk with her about things that he would not talk with other
people about and he trusted her.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the Grand Rapids Police Station also on June 26, 2020 by
DHHS Investigator 2 and Law Enforcement Officer 4. I participated by telephone.
Staff 1 denied ever kissing or holding hands with Resident A.
DHHS Investigator 2 confronted Staff 1 regarding her disclosures. DHHS
Investigator 2 inquired why a witness had disclosed seeing her kissing Resident A
and holding his hand. She denied that she has ever kissed Resident A while they
were by the woods or held his hand. She stated that she would let Resident A play
with her hands often, but they were not holding hands. She stated that they may
have hugged but that was it. Staff 1 denied that she ever had told Resident A that
"her heart was locked inside" the bear she gave him. DHHS Investigator 2 inquired
why there is phone records and evidence to support that she had corresponded with
Resident A more than she disclosed. Staff 1 admitted that she had contact with
Resident A by phone three times when she was on administrative leave. DHHS
Investigator 2 confronted Staff 1 about responding to texts from Resident A if she
was told to not have contact with him. Staff 1 admitted that she has received a text
from Resident A asking to Facetime when his foster parent was gone. She admitted
that she "liked" the text and agreed to it. Staff 1 stated that she understood how this
behavior is inappropriate between a residential staff member and a prior resident.
On July 9, 2020 I met with Chief Program Director 6 at the facility he said that their
policy is to not allow contact between staff and discharged residents. Staff 1
personnel file was reviewed. Staff 1 was hired on January 13, 2020 and her
personnel file contained all appropriate documents and training.
The facility has had 13 substantiated special investigations in the last 24 months. In
those 13 special investigations 19 rule violations were cited. These citations include
CCI 159(2) Resident restraint cited 7 times, CCI158(2) Discipline 3 times and CCI
126 Sufficiency of staff 2 times.
The following rules were cited once in the last 24 months:
 CCI142(1) Health services; policies and procedures
 CCI 109(1) Program statement CCI 159(3) Written policy of resident restraint
 CCI 150(3) Incident reporting

 CCI159 (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
procedures regarding restraint. These policies and procedures shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring agencies
 CCI128 (5) An employee shall not participate in restraining a resident or
placing a resident in seclusion prior to receiving training on those topics. The
training model shall be approved, in writing, by the department.
 CCI112 (4) previous rule CCI 112 (1) Criminal history check, subject to
requirements; staff qualifications.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
staff qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: Based upon the interviews, Staff 1 did not perform her duties
assigned and when told not to have contact with Resident A,
she proceeded to have contact with Resident A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommended based on the findings of SIR #2020C0223043 and this special
investigation, upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the license be
modified to a first provisional license.
